benchmark_details.name: Fairness through Difference Awareness: Measuring Desired Group Discrimination in LLMs
benchmark_details.overview: This paper introduces a benchmark suite composed of eight different scenarios for a total of 16,000 questions that enables assessment of difference awareness, demonstrating that treating people differently may be contextually appropriate in certain settings.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a benchmark suite designed to measure difference awareness and contextual awareness in language models.

data.source: Generated based on contextual questions covering descriptive and normative aspects of group awareness.

methodology.calculation: DiffAware = A / (A + B + C); CtxtAware = A / (A + D + E)
methodology.interpretation: Values indicate model's ability to distinguish group differences and contextual appropriateness of these differences.
methodology.validation: Empirical results based on performance across ten models
